bibl.title: Letter from A.V. McClain to Philip Showalter Hench, December 4, 1940

div1.p: McClain will follow Hench's suggestion of making still photographs from the film produced during the dedication ceremony of the Lazear Building at Washington and Jefferson College.

div1.head: Letter from A.V. McClain to Philip Showalter Hench, December 4, 1940
div1.opener:
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
WASHINGTON, PENNSYLVANIA
December 4, 1940
ASSISTANT TO THE PRESIDENT
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Thank you very much for sending me your film.
I am sending it back to you, under separate cover, by the
Railway Express.

I appreciate your suggestion regarding photo-
graphing the stills. It will enable us to get a number of
other interior scenes which will be very helpful. The
only interior scene in the gymnasium that I am having
copied is the one from the back of the building showing
most of the crowd. I will give you the extra footage that
comes from this particular scene.

We have, of course, the same outside scenes
which you have on your film.
With many thanks for your trouble, I am
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, A. V. McClain Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
